topic.title: What search engine to use?
topic.body:
DuckDuckGo: based in the US, hosted on amazon servers, reports of some censorhsip arised
Startpage: owned by ad company
Qwant: bad privacy policy
Ecosia: bad privacy again
searx: cool, but not suitable for mission critical work - constant captcha failures and every instance I tried and contrary to what ppl say, results are less accurate than even DDG.

so what options do we have?

topic.title: What does it take for people to finally care about their privacy?
topic.body:
Even Google doesn't refrain from shoving a privacy policy popup in your face on Youtube and search engine, it already says that your data is collected and yet nobody cares.

Everyone I know still uses Windows 10 which is in every aspect worse than linux , and no, not only because of lack of privacy.

smart tv malware, intel/amd CPU malware (how is it even possible that there is only one proprietary instruction set controlled by a US corporation available for consumer purchase in the whole fucking world??

Why do ppl install Tiktok? Like, wtf? It is a chinese malware, I wouldn't touch that with a 10 meter pole. 
Why use messenger? what kind of outrage of selling your data would be enough for ppl to stop using it?

I think the problem is lack of immediate observable consequences. If you touch a lit candle, you immediately feel pain and try your best to stop touching it. If someone looks over your shoulder on your piece of paper or monitor, ppl would be outraged because of "privacy" , but when something much worse is happening in your digital area, nobody cares because you can't see it. People are very uneducated about IT and that's a big problem too.

At this point, I kinda sometimes wish corpos like google and facebook start weaponizing the sheep's data in a way that is uncomfortable and finally detrimental to their everyday routine, that's the only way for ppl to finally care. The fact they do it so sneakily is working very well for them still.

topic.title: Why not suicide?
topic.body: Life is more suffering than pleasure. Life will inevitably end in death. Everything is so corrupted. So, what keeps me going? Dunno, probably animal instinct that keeps me from harming myself. What about you?

topic.title: What's the point of erotic underwear?
topic.body:
Serious question. If you take it off anyway, why bother?
Before you ask, yes I'm a virgin living in my mum's basement.

topic.title: USA should nuke China while they still stand a chance
topic.body:
Think about it, USA is a waning superpower while China is a rising one. While USA has some democracy, China is a full-blown police state with slave workers and extreme disregard for climate pollution which will probably kill all of us in some decades or even sooner than that.

USA should destroy them while they still have the chance, to protect their own freedom and delay an authoritarian makeover of the whole world.

1606253317_1H9ZCecP2nbVicgXB77yqodz2xp4C.body:
> [tttaevas](#comment_6_18sLokZGvmEqsoVbj8LJkM8NkwJxfUJX3G): Should you really care about a search engine's privacy policy if you use something like Tor?It really just depends if you value your privacy more than your time spent to find a good result, and for me, DDG's enough

i was sometimes wondering this, if I use tor, why not use google? probable reasons:
- we should support ethical alternatives
- google may actively discourage you with captchas,. throttling, popups etc.
- if a bug or fingerprinting flaw is found in Tor, you have lower chance of having your data deanonymized if it's not stored in the first place. Merely using Tor is not enough, you have to be careful with behavioral analysis, for example the style of your writing, timing correlation etc. Sure, you can't verify if anyone does what they say (not collect and store data). But still, better choose the option that is likely better, and not the one which we are 100% sure is bad.

> [bigbadbob](#comment_1205_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): Any thing that is not google is probably ok IMO.   If we always use the underdog there should always be some competition and hopefully avoid monopolies.  Hopefully it's not too late.
